alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin; Jefferson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 11:51PM CDT until July 05 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Franklin County in east central Kansas... Southeastern Jefferson County in northeastern Kansas... Douglas County in east central Kansas... * Until 1215 AM CDT. * At 1150 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles west of Tonganoxie to 3 miles southeast of Lawrence to Globe, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters 3 miles south of Lawrence. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Lawrence, Baldwin City, Eudora, Wellsville, Clinton, Lone Star, Pleasant Grove, Vinland, Globe and Williamstown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 193 and 198. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 197 and 205. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
